senses.de: Happens or is done most of the time or in most situations.
senses.ex: She took her usual route to work.

Tips.title: Frequency Context
Tips.description: ‘Usual’ indicates a high frequency, something that happens most of the time.
Tips.example: He orders the usual pizza every Friday night.

Tips.title: Routine Activities
Tips.description: Use 'usual' to describe activities that are part of a routine or habit.
Tips.example: She's having her usual morning jog in the park.

Tips.title: Predictability
Tips.description: ‘Usual’ suggests predictability in situations or behaviors.
Tips.example: The meeting followed its usual pattern of discussions and decisions.

senses.de: Ordinary and what you would expect.
senses.ex: For me a usual day starts with a cup of coffee.

Tips.title: Expectation Norm
Tips.description: ‘Usual’ describes what's expected based on past experiences or norms.
Tips.example: It was a usual weekday, filled with loads of work.

Tips.title: Ordinariness Highlight
Tips.description: Emphasizes the ordinariness or lack of uniqueness in a situation.
Tips.example: The café offered the usual array of pastries and coffee.

Tips.title: No Surprise
Tips.description: Use 'usual' when there's no element of surprise or there's comfort in familiarity.
Tips.example: He greeted me with his usual broad smile.

Common.wordDefinition:
Common means frequently occurring or found in many different situations. For example, it's common for people to use smartphones these days.

Common refers to things that are widespread or generally happening all the time, while usual describes things that are typical or expected in a specific context or for a particular person.

Common describes things that happen often or are widely seen, while usual describes things that are normal or expected in a certain situation or for a specific person.

Customary.wordDefinition:
Customary means something that is done according to a particular custom or tradition. It refers to an established practice or behavior that is followed because it has been done that way for a long time.

For example, in some cultures, it is customary to bow your head to show respect.

Customary refers to something that is done because of tradition or cultural practice, while usual refers to something that is commonly or frequently done in a situation.

Familiar.wordDefinition:
Familiar means something that is well-known or easily recognized, while usual means something that is common or expected in a particular situation.

These activities are familiar to the person because they perform them regularly.

A familiar song is one that a person knows well and can sing along to easily, while a usual meal may be one that is commonly eaten in a particular culture or region.

Familiar refers to something that is known or recognized, while usual refers to something that is typical or expected in a particular context.

Habitual.wordDefinition:
Habitual refers to something that is done repeatedly or regularly, often out of habit or routine. For example, if someone always brushes their teeth before going to bed, brushing their teeth before bed is a habitual behavior for them.

Habitual means something that is done regularly or repeatedly out of habit, while usual refers to something that is customary or typical.

Normal.wordDefinition:
The words normal and usual are similar in meaning but have slightly different connotations.

Normal means conforming to a standard or typical pattern. It implies that something is within the range of what is considered ordinary or expected.

For example, it is normal for humans to have two arms and two legs.

Normal refers to a more objective standard or definition of what is expected or acceptable, while usual refers to a more subjective and personal experience or expectation.

Ordinary.wordDefinition:
Ordinary implies something that is average or common and can be used to refer to things that do not stand out or have any special features.

For example, "I had an ordinary day at school" means that the day wasn't eventful or exceptional in any way.

The difference between the two words is that ordinary refers to something that is average without any special features, while usual refers to something that happens or appears repeatedly.

Regular.wordDefinition:
Regular means something that happens or occurs according to a set pattern or schedule, such as a regular exercise routine or a regular meeting.

Regular refers to something that happens frequently or routinely, while the word usual refers to something that is commonplace or expected in a particular situation.

Standard.wordDefinition:
Standard implies a commonly accepted level or quality that is used as a benchmark or reference point. For example, a standard size for a sheet of paper is 8.5 x 11 inches.

Standard usually refers to a specific requirement or expectation set by an authority, while usual refers to something that is common or habitual.

Typical.wordDefinition:
Typical and usual are similar words that mean similar things, but there is a slight difference between them.

Typical means something that is characteristic or representative of a particular group or situation. For example, if you say "It's typical for teenagers to spend a lot of time on their phones," you are saying that it is a common trait of teenagers to do so.

Usual means something that is normal or expected. It refers to something that happens regularly or frequently. For example, if you say "It's usual for me to have cereal for breakfast," you are saying that you typically eat cereal for breakfast.

Typical describes something that is common or representative of a group, while usual describes something that is normal or expected.

quotes.Text: I'm never certain of a performance - my own or the other actors' - or the script or anything... But to me it seems there's only one place in the world the camera can be, and the decision usually comes immediately.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Orson Welles

quotes.Text: Fame usually comes to those who are thinking about something else - very rarely to those who say to themselves, 'Go to, now, let us be a celebrated individual!'.
quotes.Title: American Writer
quotes.Name: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Sr.

quotes.Text: Usually whenever you're scared of something, do it. If you're not afraid of it, don't do it.
quotes.Title: American Actor
quotes.Name: Sylvester Stallone

quotes.Text: Of course it's the same old story. Truth usually is the same old story.
quotes.Title: English Leader
quotes.Name: Margaret Thatcher

quotes.Text: It's usually when the cameras leave that the support leaves as well.
quotes.Title: Czechoslovakian Model
quotes.Name: Petra Nemcova

quotes.Text: These people I play are not usually wish-fulfillment characters.
quotes.Title: English Actor
quotes.Name: Timothy Spall

quotes.Text: Usually my characters, though young, tend to be street-wise.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Rachel Cohn

quotes.Text: Teams usually take on the personality of the coach.
quotes.Title: American Athlete
quotes.Name: Khris Middleton

quotes.Text: Usually we are saying only part of the truth.
quotes.Title: Hungarian Inventor
quotes.Name: Erno Rubik

quotes.Text: Usually we praise only to be praised.
quotes.Title: French Writer
quotes.Name: Francois de La Rochefoucauld
